items.title: Fulham v Liverpool, Newcastle v Crystal Palace, Afcon last 16 and more: clockwatch ‚Äì live
items.summary: Craven Cottage kick-off delayed by 15 minutes Morocco v Tanzania at 4pm (GMT) | Email Tom With Portsmouth v Ipswich postponed, a win for Middlesbrough will see them go up to second in the Championship and six points behind Coventry. That Birmingham v Coventry game was a wild ride. Five goals, one red card and at the end of it the league leaders lose their second game in three. Continue reading...

items.title: Fiorentina door goal Kean in blessuretijd eindelijk van laatste plek af
items.summary: Fiorentina heeft zondag de laatste plek in de Serie A verlaten. In de strijd tegen degradatie pakte de ploeg van Paolo Vanoli drie cruciale punten tegen promovendus Cremonese. Daarvoor moesten de fans wel wachten tot de blessuretijd.

items.title: VI Live: Saibari ziet goal afgekeurd worden bij Marokko, Liverpool in de problemen
items.summary: In deze VI Live volgen we de hoogtepunten in verschillende competities. Met onder meer aandacht voor Leeds United - Manchester United, Fulham - Liverpool, de Afrika Cup en Real Madrid - Real Betis.

items.title: Rodri starts for Man City vs managerless Chelsea LIVE!
Amorim geniet ondanks puntenverlies en complimenteert Zirkzee
items.summary: R√∫ben Amorim heeft ondanks het puntenverlies van Manchester United op bezoek bij Leeds United genoten van de wedstrijd. De Portugese manager zag een vermakelijk duel, omdat beide ploegen niet tevreden waren met een punt. Daarnaast gaf hij Joshua Zirkzee een compliment.

items.title: Amorim hits out: I'm Utd manager, not the coach
items.summary: Ruben Amorim has raised doubts over his future at Manchester United by saying he wants to be the "manager, not the coach."

items.title: Aaronson scores as Leeds hold Man United
items.summary: Matheus Cunha cancelled out Brenden Aaronson's strike as Ruben Amorim's Manchester United and rivals Leeds fought out a tense 1-1 draw at rocking Elland Road.

items.title: Rice on Gy√∂keres: Wouldn't be top without him
items.summary: Declan Rice has defended goal-shy Viktor Gy√∂keres, claiming Arsenal will not be able to end their 22-year wait for a Premier League title without him.

items.title: Galaxy star Riqui Puig out until '27 after setback
items.summary: LA Galaxy star Riqui Puig's return from injury has been delayed until 2027, the LA Galaxy said Saturday after confirming that the midfielder underwent another anterior cruciate ligament reconstructive surgery on his left knee.

items.title: 'Unbelievable' Garc√≠a leads Bar√ßa to derby triumph
items.summary: Barcelona coach thanked Joan Garc√≠a for an unbelievable performance as the goalkeeper dealt with a hostile reception on his return to Espanyol to help the LaLiga leaders seal a 2-0 win at the RCDE Stadium on Saturday.

items.title: Deze route moet Marokko afleggen om de Afrika Cup te winnen
items.summary: Als groepswinnaar begint Marokko zondag aan de knock-outfase van de Afrika Cup. De Leeuwen van de Atlas krijgen steeds beter zicht op welke landen er moeten worden verslagen om het heilige doel te kunnen verzilveren: toernooiwinst. Deze landen moeten worden verslagen om dat te laten lukken.

items.title: Amorim: I came to Man Utd to be a manager, not a head coach
items.summary: Ruben Amorim has sensationally claimed that he joined Manchester United to be their manager, not their head coach, and suggested that he will leave the club at the end of his contract.

items.title: Hull & Sheff Utd fixtures among 17 EFL games off
items.summary: Hull's game against Watford becomes the latest English Football League fixture on Sunday to be postponed because of freezing conditions.

items.title: Farke 'disappointed' with draw against Man Utd
items.summary: Leeds manager Daniel Farke says he's "a bit disappointed" with a 1-1 draw against Manchester United, adding "it's not the best performance but good to take a point and move on".

items.title: Onklopbaar Leeds baalt van remise tegen Man Utd: 'Dat zegt heel veel'
items.summary: Leeds United speelde woensdag gelijk tegen Manchester United en daar werd bij de Engelse promovendus nog van gebaald ook. Er had meer ingezeten, voelde men op Elland Road. Onderwijl bouwde Leeds verder aan een imposante reeks.

items.title: A tough match in tough conditions - Amorim
items.summary: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim says "it's hard to find a game where it is satisfying to draw" after their game at Leeds finished 1-1 but says his side played well in "a tough match in tough conditions".

items.title: Championship roundup: leaders Coventry slip up again in thriller at Birmingham
items.summary: Ducksch double edges Birmingham to 3-2 home victory QPR ease past bottom side Sheffield Wednesday Marvin Ducksch scored twice as Birmingham ended their seven-game winless streak with a 3-2 victory over Championship leaders Coventry. The former Germany international grabbed a goal in each half as fortunes ebbed and flowed in a derby fixture that delivered drama from the first whistle until stoppage time when visiting defender Bobby Thomas was dismissed. Birmingham led three times but were pegged back twice by Frank Lampard‚Äôs side, who have now won just twice in their last eight outings. Continue reading...

items.title: European football: Napoli hold off Lazio in fiery contest with three red cards
items.summary: Spinazzola and Rrahmani goals earn 2-0 away win Sevilla slump to 3-0 home defeat against Levante First-half goals from Leonardo Spinazzola and Amir Rrahmani helped Napoli claim a 2-0 victory at Lazio on Sunday in a heated contest that featured three red cards. Victory moves Napoli back to one point behind Serie A leaders Milan, who won 1-0 at Cagliari on Friday. Inter sit third but can reclaim top spot with victory at home to Bologna later on Sunday. This story will be updated Continue reading...

items.title: Matheus Cunha earns Manchester United point as Leeds keep up unbeaten run
items.summary: Few of the near 40,000 that flooded the Elland Road terraces would have cared to admit it given the depths at which one of English football‚Äôs most intense rivalries runs, but it was hard to argue that this was anything but a well-earned point apiece that serves the intentions and ambitions of both Leeds and Manchester United well. On first glance, a draw away at a relegation-threatened, newly-promoted side does little in terms of oozing positivity. But given the fact Ruben Amorim selected a starting lineup with nine defensive-minded players and the visitors were facing a Leeds side now on their longest unbeaten run in the Premier League since 2001, they will view this as a point gained. Continue reading...

items.title: 'When has it ever been this bad?' - McCowan haunted by Celtic form
items.summary: Luke McCowan asks "when has it ever been this bad?" in the wake of Celtic's 3-1 home defeat by Rangers on Saturday.
